body:
your codesandbox is not throwing errors, it's a deep partial in the type. 

`defaultValues: UnpackNestedValue<DeepPartial<TFieldValues>>;`

@bluebill1049 Yeah, I'm not sure why the codesandbox is not throwing errors but my local environment is. Things seem to be the same. All I know, unfortunately, is that the bump from v6.8.6 to v6.9.0 caused me to start getting those errors, so we're currently locking to v6.8.x. I'm seeing the same error behavior with v6.9.1.
which version of TS you guys are using?

Having the same problem. Just caused our build to suddenly fail despite succeeding before the new version.

The code in this PR was changed from `defaultValues = {}` to `defaultValues = {} as UnpackNestedValue<DeepPartial<TFieldValues>>`. Same thing but with an added type assertion.

Clearly providing `{}` for the `defaultValues` was working before that change but the added type assertion in this line proves that removing `Partial` from the type definition just messed things up. Otherwise the additional assertion wouldn't be needed.

Aside from that, passing `{}` for the `defaultValues` used to work and now it doesn't. That's a breaking change and shouldn't be in a minor version bump anyway.

And before you ask, yes I saw the discussion about removing that `Partial`. Clearly it was added for a reason in the first place. May not have been the best solution for the problem at the time but still worked. Simply removing it isn't imho a fix either because it invalidates the original fix and brings back the initial issue you were trying to solve. So back to square 1 (which is what's causing this issue now)

@wendorf Tested on 3.9.2 and let me know if you can reproduce this in a git repo, happy to take a look at it. 

https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?ts=3.9.2#code/CYUwxgNghgTiAEYD2A7AzgF3gEgHIkxGADUoIBXEALnnJQEsBHS+NATwFsAjJCAbgBQAkAA8ADkhhYMbMQgAiIEGIAKsDPTIAeACoA+eAF54O+KIwgUwNPACCMGFDZb6KAGYgY8AKp6B8eAB+OwcnLUVlNSlNCC1fPwCaU3NLa3gAJRAoYFQINntHZ1cPL19--TxkToJ3u72sQPyjWFf965gAEzNoltjsYLs9mjjiZDqAj9d9ulbl78oE0FsvZe7sf9w8veDD1ejjfXwcvKfvUszgDy5AwYh-TeMdNVXVY1uVBa4mjuTlWg-JVv1-H8F0AjMQOzMCdQg6IoMwBsYNrL8fz-DAAGYqyAzNQNNTDbliCt5xgoQgA

> which version of TS you guys are using?

tried updating to the latest TS version just in case (v4.0.3 as I'm writing this) and it didn't help unfortunately

@dolma can you help to try to reproduce the issue in here?  (perhaps i am missing something...)

https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?ts=3.9.2#code/CYUwxgNghgTiAEYD2A7AzgF3gEgHIkxGADUoIBXEALnnJQEsBHS+NATwFsAjJCAbgBQAkAA8ADkhhYMbMQgAiIEGIAKsDPTIAeACoA+eAF54O+KIwgUwNPACCMGFDZb6KAGYgY8AKp6B8eAB+OwcnLUVlNSlNCC1fPwCaU3NLa3gAJRAoYFQINntHZ1cPL19--TxkToJ3u72sQPyjWFf965gAEzNoltjsYLs9mjjiZDqAj9d9ulbl78oE0FsvZe7sf9w8veDD1ejjfXwcvKfvUszgDy5AwYh-TeMdNVXVY1uVBa4mjuTlWg-JVv1-H8F0AjMQOzMCdQg6IoMwBsYNrL8fz-DAAGYqyAzNQNNTDbliCt5xgoQgA

@wendorf (cc. @Fakkio) try declaring your `FormValues` definition as a type instead. Worked for me.

Although this is not a solution, just a temporary fix.

> @bluebill1049
> 
> ok I think I know what the issue is. Looks like one of the custom types (either UnpackNestedValue or DeepPartial) just doesn't work with interfaces. With equal definitions, the version declared as a Type works with `{}` but not the one declared as an interface. See this playground:
> 
> https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?ts=3.9.2#code/CYUwxgNghgTiAEYD2A7AzgF3gEgHIkxGADUoIBXEALnnJQEsBHS+NATwFsAjJCAbgBQAkAA8ADkhhYMbMQgAiIEGIAKsDPTIAeACoA+eAF54O+KIwgUwNPACCMGFDZb6KAGYgY8AKp6B8eAB+OwcnLUVlNSlNCC1fPwCaU3NLa3gAJRAoYFQINntHZ1cPL19--4NzAAZhb5XbnYw3d7NAnE2HUFH6-7dK3AX5QJorYCy9344Hh42I9XY4316HAXe71cFhgbjV5c5AEkUB+X5gAgrYXvee6bs+8B3muV4HkO7yljOADy5AYGIaHVsY6aquqxrcqC1xNHcVatEhSqoehaHNthGZ4dmBE6kR0QkZgjZkfWlEYRgC60bhWZAqazG3LEFbzhxKFodx-6Ad+NY4Zm+FCUojQsaJf4AZ4QEgGRAjIOgWBIFJmFiRgNBcZhLavII+mYPARlURgjameZxlOVZNmoHZDncXOLnwBZPEeXpXmGW5Mlad+-mBRFn5ycYKzWUAA

oh....
